questions.question_text:
An architect is tasked with the following:
✑ Build a private cloud solution for an organization using VMware vRealize Automation.
✑ This private cloud needs to manage two different datacenters separated geographically.
✑ The private cloud solution needs to be highly available.
Which of the following approaches can the architect take to achieve this?
Note: VMware Identity Manager has been renamed as VMware Workspace ONE Access.

choices.B: Deploy a 3-node Workspace ONE Access cluster in a single-site design architecture in one of the datacenters.
choices.C: Deploy a single-node Workspace ONE Access instance in a single-site design architecture in one of the datacenters.
choices.D: Deploy a Workspace ONE Access cluster in a multi-site design architecture with 3-nodes in each of the datacenters.
choices.A: Deploy a Workspace ONE Access cluster in a multi-site design architecture with 3-nodes spanning both the datacenters.

discussion.content:
Correct Answer: D

Workspace ONE Access is the primary entry point for end users to consume all types of applications, including SaaS, web, VMware Horizon virtual desktops and published applications, Citrix XenApp and XenDesktop, and mobile apps. Therefore, when deployed on-premises, "it should be highly available within a site", and "also deployed in a secondary data center for failover and redundancy".

https://techzone.vmware.com/resource/workspace-one-access-architecture#load-balancing

All 3 nodes have to be in the same location, so not A.
You must deploy a cluster, so not C.
No such thing as a 6-node WS1A cluster, so not D.
It has to be B.

comments.content: you need to cross region architecture

choices.B: Request Certificate Authority (CA)-signed certificate containing the VIP FQDN and the FQDN of the VMware Identity Manager nodes
choices.C: Request Certificate Authority (CA)-signed certificate containing the VIP FQDN and the FQDN of all the cluster nodes
choices.D: Request certificate containing VIP FQDN for each Organization for vRealize Automation VIP
choices.A: Request certificate containing VIP FQDN for each Organization for VMware Identity Manager VIP

questions.question_text:
A design for a Cloud Management solution includes a section that describes the association of vRealize Operations solution with a remote collector for the purpose of gathering performance and usage metrics.
Which area of the design would contain that section?

discussion.content:
The Answer is A

Logical Design:
The logical design includes the integration of VMware Aria Automation with the supporting infrastructure and private cloud services. The networking, identity and access management, product configurations, and secure access must be designed for seamless integration between VMware Aria Automation and other components.

Remember that VVD (VMware Validated Design) was deprecated and now our source of truth is the VMware Validated Solutions. 

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/services/vcf-cloud-based-automation-v1/GUID-C0D66603-45DD-4F16-889A-7C2D1CAE9B52.html
